Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2010 06:45PM nixi wrote:  a number of years ago i  had such a horrible problem with this that i actually created a tear in my rectum (which took about a year to heal, etc.,).  What finally ended up helping me (in addition to Lactulose) was the daily use of Fleet Liquid Glycerin Suppositories.   Please note that these are not the "bullet" type glycerin suppositories - tried them and they didn't work for me) but they are little plastic bulbs filled with liquid glycerin. They worked pretty quickly, too.   They come in a small box as they are only about 3 inches tall.   They can be tricky to find so I had my pharmacy order them for me by the case (be sure to keep your receipts for your taxes as, if you use them every day, the $$'s add up).  Believe me, I tried EVERYTHING and I too was at the point where they were talking surgery... I was scared and frustrated and very uncomfortable.  But these babies did the trick...I hope they work for you, too.  LeeLee

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2010 09:22PM nixi wrote: Hi Mason204  I had EXTREME constipation when on chemo.  I tried just about everything in the book and what finally worked for me were "Fleet Glycerine Suppositories".  FYI: these are NOT the same as Fleet enemas - make sure you get the glycerine suppositories - they are little bulbs filled with glycerine which you insert the same way you would insert a suppository - you can get them at your pharmacy.    I suffered for many  months with this problem to the point where I ended up having a tear in my rectum - which I promise you, you don't want. They work very differently than ducolax and regular suppositories/enemas.   I urge you to try these.    I hope they help.  Good luck.  Big hugs, Nixi
